alert.note: Alert for Inland Southern Brevard (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 30 at 3:06PM EDT until October 03 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: .Heavy rainfall over the past few days has already led to some localized flooding and saturated ground conditions, especially along the east central Florida coast. A lingering stalled front across the region may produce persistent heavy rain bands and storms tonight through Sunday, continuing the potential for locally heavy to excessive rainfall across the coastal counties of east central Florida. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following areas, Coastal Indian River, Coastal Martin, Coastal Saint Lucie, Coastal Volusia, Inland Indian River, Inland Martin, Inland Northern Brevard, Inland Saint Lucie, Inland Southern Brevard, Inland Volusia, Mainland Northern Brevard, Mainland Southern Brevard, Northern Brevard Barrier Islands and Southern Brevard Barrier Islands. * WHEN...Through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall over the past several days has led to saturated ground conditions, especially along the coast. Additional localized heavy to excessive rainfall will be possible across the east central Florida coastal counties tonight through Sunday. Should any persistent bands of stronger showers or storms develop, this will lead to additional flooding, especially for any areas that have already experienced flooding issues the past couple days and in poor drainage and low lying areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
